itemDescription: Archdeacon of Hampstead; Principal of the Clergy Training School, Cambridge; British Anglican priest

wikipedia_page.main: Charles Edmund Lambert (4 April 1872 – 1 April 1954) was a British Anglican priest who served as Principal of the Clergy Training School (now Westcott House, Cambridge) and as Archdeacon of Hampstead.

response: *Charles Lambert (economist), Deputy Under Secretary for the United States Department of Agriculture Marketing and Regulatory Programs
*Charles Lambert (Archdeacon of Hampstead) (1872–1954), British Anglican priest
*Charles Lambert (Archdeacon of Lancaster) (1894–1983), British Anglican priest
*Charles Lambert (author) (born 1953), English novelist and short-story writer
*Charles Lambert (water polo) (1932–1990), French Olympic water polo player
